answers.answer: Only your vet will be able to answer this for you.  It's pretty odd for stitches to open after 5 days.  Usually by the fourth day the skin has healed to the point where it would take a pretty good strain to open the stitches.  Does your dog have any health issues that would prevent healing, such as diabetes?  I know she's only 7 months old, but this is not normal.  It makes me wonder if she has some type of problem that would prevent her from healing normally?  Anyway, back to the stitch problem itself, as I said, only your vet will be able to make the call as to whether or not she needs to be stitched again or whether an antibiotic ointment will suffice after this amount of time.  Please let us know how things go.Ghilly

Call the vet....ask about the stitch, and describe to him if the area looks or smells infected.  Ask about using antibiotic ointment....and a butterfly bandaid to help keep the area closed.  A phone call is cheap and easy and is considered part of the aftercare of a dog..Best wishes...Connie

question: Got my female dog spayed (7months old) few days back. A few stitches opened after 5 days and the vet had to restitch it again. even after restitching, one of the stiches has opened within 24 hrs and the rest look fine. she has been confined to one place and  a collar is being used to prevent her from biting or licking her stitches. is there a need for stitches again or some antibiotic can be used for the one stitch that has opened.
title: Stitches open post spraying
